lexUnit.name: hung.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: covered or adorned with hanging objects

sentence.text: In the corner of the room is a large bed hung with a dark musty surrounding curtain .
The plaster work had been restored and gilded so that it glittered against a dazzling white ceiling and against walls hung with crimson wallpaper .
I arrived in good time and was shown into a small living-room where a clothes-horse , hung with baby clothes , stood steaming before an electric fire .
If the day had been wet , the kitchen range would be surrounded by a huge clothes horse hung with wet washing , and the room would smell of steam and drying clothes .
The walls were hung with furs and there were piles of deer skins in the corner .
His mother 's bedroom , once hung with hand-painted eighteenth century Chinese wall-paper , now ripped and defaced and stained with urine .
The foyer and staircase are hung with Mondrian-inspired abstract paintings .
A dull grey winter Saturday morning was kept out by tall windows hung with faded velvet drapes .
The three boys sat under heavy guard in a glowglobe-lit room hung with a tapestry depicting the march across the wastes three centuries earlier .
The bedrooms are furnished individually , one with a wall hung with hats , another with bells hung from beams .
It was only then she saw what she should have noticed immediately : a bunch of keys with one stuck in the lock , many of them hung with labels .
Upstairs , the master bedroom has a magnificent four-poster , hung with Indian silk drapes and dressed with crisp white antique bedlinen .

Above him , the ward 's Christmas decorations looped in colours of green , red , silver , gold and white , and his elbow threatened to knock over a small ornamental tree hung with miniature packages .
All the walls were hung with hunting prints which were anonymously expensive , bought on advice by a man without natural taste .
Tamarisk and acacia trees stood by walls whose whitewash was truly white , not dun coloured , and which hid formal gardens , not cramped courtyards hung with washing .
Around the walls of the Sligo library hung framed pages of a magazine named Broadsheet , dated 1903 .
